banaji.a.description: My main research interests relate to the geometry and dimension theory of fractal sets and measures. I have worked with fractals generated by conformal and non-conformal iterated function systems. Much of my research has been about interpolating between different notions of dimension. I am interested in finding connections between fractal geometry and other areas of mathematics.
banaji.a.name: Amlan Banaji

bleak.c.description: My research is in studying infinite groups of homeomorphisms via properties of their actions. In this study I employ tools from various fields including algebra, theoretical computer science, combinatorics, symbolic dynamical systems, and analysis.
bleak.c.name: Collin Bleak

couto.r.description: I am broadly interested in dynamical systems and ergodic theory, more recently focusing on properties of chaotic systems through the study of dynamically defined stochastic processes.
couto.r.name: Raquel Couto

derry.l.description: I am interested in C*-algebras, curvature measures, and multifractal analysis.
derry.l.name: Luke Derry

dimoudis.s.description: I am interested in operator and spectral theory and their applications in mathematical quantum mechanics, specifically, in the analysis of non-self-adjoint Schrödinger, and related, operators.
dimoudis.s.name: Spyridon Dimoudis

falconer.k.description: My research centres around the geometry of fractals and multifractals, geometric measure theory, dimension theory, dynamical systems and probability. Specific topics include self-affine sets and measures, sections and projections of fractals, random fractals and stochastic processes, and applications of fractals to other areas.
falconer.k.name: Kenneth Falconer

fraser.j.description: My research interests centre on fractal geometry and its connections with other areas of mathematics, such as: geometric measure theory, ergodic theory, Fourier analysis, and hyperbolic geometry. Particular topics include: self-affine sets, self-similar sets with overlaps, limit sets of Kleinian groups, and Fourier transforms of random measures associated with Brownian motion.
fraser.j.name: Jonathan Fraser
fraser.j.title: Head of Group

jurga.n.description: My research interests lie in the interplay between dynamical systems, ergodic theory and fractal geometry. More specific topics include: dimension theory of dynamical systems, random matrix products, self-affine sets, transfer operator methods and thermodynamic formalism.
jurga.n.name: Natalia Jurga

karvatskyi.d.name: Dmytro Karvatskyi
karvatskyi.d.description: My research is devoted to the study of sets having a complicated local structure, such as fractals, Cantorvals, fat Cantor sets, etc. Such sets naturally appear in various branches of mathematics. In particular, they are attractors for some iterated function systems.
karvatskyi.d.title: Visiting

kolossvary.i.description: My current research interest is in fractal geometry and geometric measure theory, mainly concentrated around the dimension theory of self-affine sets and measures.
kolossvary.i.name: István Kolossváry

mccabe.j.description: My research interests have generally been in rational approximation, and pade approximation and the related continued fractions in particular. In collaboration with others, mainly overseas and including my Ph.D students, I have worked on strong moment problems.
mccabe.j.name: John McCabe

olsen.l.description: My research covers all aspects of fractal and multifractal geometry and geometric measure theory, including work on self-affine sets and measures, fractals defined by digits of numbers, typical structure of fractal sets and measures, etc.
olsen.l.name: Lars Olsen

orellana.a.de.description: My research interests revolve around the connections between geometric measure theory, dimension theory, and Fourier analysis.
orellana.a.de.name: Ana de Orellana

rutar.a.description: I am primarily interested in fractal geometry and dynamical systems, including (but not limited to) the geometry of self-similar and self-affine sets and associated invariant measures, multifractal analysis, and general dimension theory and dimension interpolation.
rutar.a.name: Alex Rutar

shaabanian.s.description: My tendency is Dynamical systems and Ergodic Theory, also I researched into the relation between ergodic theory and operator algebra.
shaabanian.s.name: Saeed Shaabanian

stuart.l.description: I am interested in fractals and dimension theory, in particular limit sets of geometrically finite Kleinian groups and Julia sets of parabolic rational maps.
stuart.l.name: Liam Stuart

todd.m.description: I work in ergodic theory and dynamical systems, applying ideas from probability and thermodynamic formalism to study expansion and recurrence properties of, mostly, smooth low dimensional systems. Topics include Return Time Statistics, Extreme Value Theory, statistical stability, equilibrium states, phase transitions and transience.
todd.m.name: Mike Todd

zhang.s.description: My research interests relate to multifractal geometry, in particular in-homogeneous self-similar measures.
zhang.s.name: Shuqin Zhang
zhang.s.title: Visiting

zhao.b.description: My interests in mathematics are generally in ergodic theory, symbolic dynamics, and low-dimensional interval maps with possible applications to cryptography.
zhao.b.name: Boyuan Zhao
